story:
Battle Cancer is one day, four nine-minute workouts, one fundraising goal.
Set yourself a challenge, give yourself a purpose and take part in an epic day!
Battle Cancer combines playful functional fitness workouts with a teamwork experience like no other. We're not about finding the strongest or fittest, Battle Cancer is a mindset, a community and battling something bigger than us all.

1. Enter as a team of four (all male, all female, or mixed - any combination of gender: 2 men 2 women, 1 man 3 women, 1 woman 3 men. 

2. Fundraise for Macmillan in the lead up to the competition and submit your fundraising total at registration. This will rank you on the leaderboard for your chance to get a leg up on the competition before any fitness takes place!

3. Compete in four 9-minute fitness workouts over the course of the day

4. End on a huge sense of accomplishment

Whether you are participating in the UK, Europe or America - thank you for playing a part in supporting Macmillan.

In July, our daughter Jo Riding was diagnosed with breast cancer.  At 42 and with 3 young children, this came as a devastating blow. rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
story:
Thank you for visiting my JustGiving page. 

Felixstowe is a large container port and many Felixstowe residents are connected with the  sea so we are very aware of the need for support for the RNLI. Our nearest lifeboat station is Harwich so our fundraising is very relevant to the local community.

We would normally hold several events each year, card sales, concerts and a street collection as well as other one off events but COVID has significantly effected our ability to fundraise.

Your donations at our events ensure that our volunteer crews bring people home back safely to their loved ones.

Thank you so much for your donation which will help us raise the money we would normally raise through our face to face activity. 

RNLI lifeboats in East of England protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. They rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from. The RNLI relies on donations from you the public to continue saving lives at sea.

rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
story:
Yemen is experiencing the world's worst humanitarian crisis. A devastating conflict has left children and families in urgent need of food, water and supplies.

More than five years of fighting has already pushed Yemen and its health system to the brink of collapse. Millions of children lack access to clean water and sanitation facilities and are in desperate need of basic healthcare. Malnutrition is also at an all-time high.

Unicef is on the ground working around the clock to protect children in Yemen. Since the start of the crisis, they have helped to reach more than 4 million children with over 3,000 tonnes of life-saving supplies, including food, safe drinking water and health care supplies.

Your support will also help to ensure that displaced children do not miss out on an education. Through Unicef-supported schools and child-friendly spaces, children can continue their schooling and receive psychosocial care and support to help them cope with distress and trauma.

So if you know your Khans from your Kapoors, love to dance along with Munni and Sheila and your lifelong dream is to frolic in the mountains of Switzerland in a chiffon sari / gaudy sweater on your shoulders then join the Bollywood quiz on 7th November to support this cause.
